disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 24 June to end of Friday 24 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Generally cloudy on Friday with a fresh south-westerly breeze.<br/><br/>The 'clean' south-westerly air-feed should limit the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form. In addition, increased cloud cover will reduce the ability of sunlight to power these reactions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 25 June to end of Saturday 25 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Breezier through the weekend with a fresh south-westerly. Perhaps the odd shower at times. Temperatures near average or just below for late June. Generally cloudy.<br/><br/>The 'clean' south-westerly air-feed should limit the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form. In addition, increased cloud cover will reduce the ability of sunlight to power these reactions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide
